sen.j: 西園寺 公宗（さいおんじ きんむね、延慶 (日本)3年（1310年） - 建武 (日本)2年8月2日 (旧暦)（1335年8月20日））は、鎌倉時代末期から建武の新政にかけての公家である。
sen.e: Kinmune SAIONJI (born 1310, died August 2, 1335 (old lunar calendar) (August 20, 1335)) was a court noble from the end of Kamakura Period to Kenmu Restoration.
Kinmune SAIONJI (born 1310, died August 2, 1335 (old lunar calendar) (August 20, 1335)) was a court noble from the end of the Kamakura Period to the Kenmu Restoration.
Kinmune SAIONJI (born 1310, died August 28, 1335) was a court noble from the end of the Kamakura Period to the Kenmu Restoration.

sen.j: 父は内大臣の西園寺実衡。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin Sanehira SAIONJI.

sen.j: 母は昭訓門院春日局（権大納言二条為世女）。
sen.e: His mother was Shokunmonin no kasuganotsubone (a daughter of Tameyo NIJO, who served as Gondainagon (provisional major counselor)).

sen.j: 正室は日野名子（権大納言日野資名女）。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Meishi HINO (a daughter of Gondainagon Sukena HINO).

sen.j: 関東申次の役目を預かっていた西園寺家は鎌倉幕府の滅亡で役職を停止された。
sen.e: The Saionji family, who had served as moshitsugi (court-appointed liaison with the bakufu), lost their post with the defeat of the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 1334年(建武元)には公宗は地位の回復を図って幕府滅亡後の北条氏の残党らと連絡し、北条高時の弟である北条泰家(時興)を匿っていた。
sen.e: In 1334, in an attempt to restore his status, Kinmune liaised with the remnants of the Hojo clan after the fall of shogunate and harbored Yasuie (Tokioki) HOJO, the younger brother of Takatoki HOJO.

sen.j: 2人は後醍醐天皇を西園寺家の山荘（後の鹿苑寺）に招いて天皇を暗殺し、後伏見天皇を擁立して新帝を即位させることで新政を覆そうと謀略した。
sen.e: Kinmune and Yasuie plotted to overthrow the new government by inviting Emperor Godaigo to a Saionji family's mountain villa (which later became Rokuon-ji Temple) for assassination, and by helping the Emperor Gofushimi to the throne.
sen.cmt: 「2人」は「公宗と泰家」の意味に解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: だが、公宗の異母弟の西園寺公重の密告で計画が発覚し、日野氏光らとともに逮捕された。
sen.e: However, Kinshige SAIONJI, the stepbrother of Kinmune, betrayed and revealed the plot, resulting in the arrest of Kinmune and Ujimitsu HINO.

sen.j: 出雲国（島根県）へ流刑される途中に名和長年に処刑された（現職公卿の処刑は1159年の平治の乱以来の出来事とされる）。
sen.e: On his way to deportation to Izumo Province (Shimane Prefecture), he was killed by Nagatoshi NAWA (it was believed to be the first execution of incumbent court noble since the Heiji Rebellion in 1159).

sen.j: 後に信濃国（長野県）で北条時行が蜂起する中先代の乱が起こる。
sen.e: Tokiyuki HOJO later revolted in the Nakasendai Rebellion in Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture).

sen.j: 建武の新政が崩壊すると、公重も吉野へ向かった。

sen.j: このため、公宗の息子西園寺実俊が室町幕府の「武家執奏」に任じられて以後その子孫が西園寺家の嫡流となった。
sen.e: His son, Sanetoshi SAIONJI, was then appointed to 'bukeshisso (an intermediary between the Northern Court and the Ashikaga government)' for the Muromachi bakufu; his descendants has become the main branch of the Saionji family since then.
